question.body: Which portion of coronary circulation supplies the left ventricle and left atrium?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The posterior interventricular branch provides blood supply to the two ventricles.
Incorrect. The marginal branch provides blood to the right ventricle.
Incorrect. The anterior interventricular branch provides blood to the ventricles.
Correct. The circumflex branch provides blood to the left ventricle and left atria.
